panels.description: status of all systems at the last timestamp of the selected range

targets.expr: sum(group((system_overall_health{system=~"$system_filter"} != 1) and (system_overall_health{system=~"$system_filter"} != 2) and (system_overall_health{system=~"$system_filter"} != -1)) by (system) or group by (system) (system_overall_health{system=~"$system_filter"}) != bool(1))

panels.title: Overall CS2 Status

panels.description: Number of CS2 Systems by Job

targets.expr:
count by (name, labels_k8s_cerebras_com_Model) (group by (name, system) (wsjob_system_grant{system =~"$system_filter"})) * on (name) group_left(labels_k8s_cerebras_com_Model) group by(name, labels_k8s_cerebras_com_Model) 
(wsjob_annotation{job_type!="compile"})

panels.title: CS2 Jobs Histogram

panels.description: CS2 Subsystem Errors. Change the Subsystem variable to view different subsystems
panels.title: CS2 Subsystem Errors ($subsystem_filter)

panels.description:
The line represents the average CPU load of all nodes of that node type
The shaded area indicates the min and max CPU load% of that node type
panels.title: CPU load

panels.description:
Line represents the average mem usage for all nodes of that node type
Shaded area of that color marks the min and max use% of that node type
panels.title: Memory usage
Total Network Ingress Rate by Role
Total Network Egress Rate by Role

panels.description: K8s Nodes having error/warnings can cause scheduling failure
panels.title: Node Warning/Errors

panels.description: display hosts with root Disk Usage > 85%

targets.expr:
max(label_replace(
    (((node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/"}-node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/"})/node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/"}) > .85),
    "internal_ip", "$1", "instance", "([^:]+):.*"
) * on (internal_ip) group_left (node) group(kube_node_info) by (node, internal_ip)) by (node)

panels.title: Root Disk Usage > 85%

panels.description: Shows NFS mount errors per node
panels.title: NFS Mount Errors

panels.description: Breakdown of CS2 System Port Errors
panels.title: CS2 System Port Errors

panels.description: Time and duration of port issues (port is down or had one or more flaps) - only for explicitly tracked ports from the network_config.json

targets.expr: (sum (group by (ifName, switch_id) (min_over_time(ifOperStatus[10m])!=1) * on (ifName, switch_id) group_left (conn_type, node, device) interface_watch_list{switch_id!=""}) by (switch_id, ifName, conn_type, node, device)> 0) or (group by (ifName, switch_id) (changes(ifLastChange[10m])>0) * on (ifName, switch_id) group_left (conn_type, node, device) interface_watch_list{switch_id!=""})

panels.title: Switch Port Problems
Switch Port Flap Count - Increase During Time Range
Switch Port Flap Count - Absolute Values
Network Warning Conditions - Uncorrected Errors and Other Failures

panels.description: Switch port uncorrectable packet errors can cause port flaps or other network failures
panels.title: Switch FEC Uncorrected Errors

panels.description: System uncorrectable packet errors can cause port flaps or other network failures
panels.title: CS2 FEC/PCS Uncorrected Errors

panels.description: Node NIC uncorrectable packet errors can cause port flaps or other network failures
panels.title: Node FEC/PCS Uncorrected Errors

panels.description: Internal NIC errors: device crash/hang and send/receive transaction failures. Generally indicates driver or NIC hardware problems, not user software or cabling.
panels.title: Node NIC Device/Driver Errors

panels.description: Correctable FEC errors do not cause flaps or other network failures
panels.title: Switch FEC Corrected Errors

panels.description: Correctable FEC errors do not cause flaps or other network failures
panels.title: CS2 FEC/PCS Corrected Errors

panels.description: Correctable FEC errors do not cause flaps or other network failures
panels.title: Node FEC/PCS Corrected Errors
